info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 7:59PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Columbus, southeastern Dillon, northwestern Horry and northeastern Marion Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 758 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kemper, or 7 miles northeast of Mullins, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marion, Mullins, Tabor City, Loris, Fair Bluff, Lake View, Fork, Zion, Cherry Grove, Gapway, Smithboro, Kemper, Goretown, Green Sea, Nichols, Carolinas Hospital System - Marion and Loris Community Hospital. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
